alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 10:58PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CHST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Guam. * WHEN...Until 130 AM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 PM ChST, satellite estimates indicate heavy rain from showers in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.6 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.6 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dededo, Tamuning, Yigo, Mangilao, Chalan Pago-Ordot, Barrigada, Yona, Hagatna Heights, Andersen AFB, Talofofo, Mongmong-Toto-Maite, Sinajana, Inarajan, Asan, Merizo, Piti, Santa Rita and Umatac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
